content.en: Enhancing NOMA Systems: Researchers are exploring ways to improve the performance of grant-free non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) systems. They are investigating various algorithms, such as those based on compressive sensing and adaptive methods, to achieve joint user activity and data detection, multi-user detection, channel estimation, and low-complexity detection in these systems. These algorithms aim to enhance the efficiency and reliability of uplink communication in NOMA systems, which could have implications for applications like massive Internet of Things (IoT) access.
content.da: Forbedring af NOMA-systemer: Forskere udforsker måder at forbedre ydeevnen af grant-free non-ortogonal multiple access (NOMA) systemer. De undersøger forskellige algoritmer, såsom dem baseret på komprimeret sensing og adaptive metoder, for at opnå fælles brugeraktivitet og datadetektion, multi-brugerdetektion, kanalestimering og lav-kompleksitetsdetektion i disse systemer. Disse algoritmer sigter mod at forbedre effektiviteten og pålideligheden af uplink-kommunikation i NOMA-systemer, hvilket kunne have betydning for applikationer som massiv Internet of Things (IoT) adgang.
